name: Papa
headline: One-stop-shop for flexible family care
description:
Papa is a one-stop-shop for flexible family care, providing companionship and a helping hand wherever it’s needed. With wide-ranging industry, technology, and transformation experience, we share a vision for a world where no one has to go it alone. And a deep well of gratitude for the Papa People who move this vision forward.

Founded in 2017 and headquartered in Miami, Papa is backed by Canaan, Tiger Global Management, Comcast Ventures, SoftBank Vision Fund 2, TCG, Initialized Capital, and Seven Seven Six, among other revered institutional and individual investors. 

Papa is an equal opportunity employer. We proudly support the ParityPledge® for gender and/or racial parity at the highest levels of business.

founders.name: Andrew Parker, Founder/CEO
founders.description: Founded Papa to support older adults and families. Grew up in South Florida and started my career in sales. Cut my teeth in start up / healthcare world with MDLIVE. Started on the team in 2011 and helped grow the company to over 35M members by 2017. Left in 2017 to focus on Papa full time, been doing that ever since. Love growing Papa, snowboarding, hanging with Romi (gf) and Chewie (dog), reading, nice dinners, and spending time with family and friends.

# Hi! We’re Papa.
We all need a pal sometimes. That’s why Papa’s here. 
Papa helps health plans and employers connect members and their families to real people for help with companion care, everyday tasks, transportation, and more. It’s vital human connection, right to the front door.
I'd like to learn...how Papa works with health planswhy employers choose Papawhere I can sign up to be a Papa Palhow to get started as a memberabout career opportunities at Papa
![Companion care.](https://images.papa.com/wp-content/uploads/2024/05/companion-care.webp)
## Companion care
Papa Pals provide vital social support and companion care to strengthen families, help older adults remain connected, and support diverse communities—providing win-win benefits for all.
### Promote independence
Papa gives older adults and the elderly companion care and support to age in place. 
### Reduce inequities
Papa advances equity for populations that have been historically marginalized.
### Cure loneliness
No one’s meant to go it alone. With Papa, “together” is just a call or click away.
### Improve outcomes
Research shows that members feel physically and mentally healthier with Papa.
### Control costs
Papa members have fewer visits to the hospital and are more likely to receive preventive care—the results add up.
### Increase satisfaction
Our one-of-a-kind benefit helps health plans retain members and employers attract—and keep!—talent.
Play video in a dialog
## Health Plans
Meet your members where they are with flexible support to assist older adults, other underserved populations, and families in overcoming social barriers to health and well-being. Dozens of health plans and employers work with Papa in a shared mission to help Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, and Special Needs Health Plan members live and feel better.
[Companion Care Services](https://www.papa.com/</health-plans>)
## Employers
Attract and retain talent with a whole-family benefit that lightens the load on family caregivers, fosters physical and mental health, and gives your team time back in the day. Papa is not another digital front door, we’re help right to the door.
[Corporate Wellness Programs](https://www.papa.com/</corporate-wellness-programs>)
## Papa Pals
Get a flexible job you can feel good about, helping members of your community on your schedule while working (and earning) as much as you like. Learn how Papa Pals create healthy connections, one visit at a time.
[Be a Papa Pal](https://www.papa.com/</pals>)
## Members
Get help that comes to you or your loved ones. Papa is companion care that feels like family—when, where, and how you want it. Learn how to make your next pal, through your participating health plan.
[Member information](https://www.papa.com/</members>)
  * ## Stephen and Marcel
In Unseen Connection, Papa member Stephen, who is visually impaired, shares how his Papa Pal Marcel, a retired Veteran, helps him overcome loneliness and social isolation through the power of human connection.
[Watch their story](https://www.papa.com/<https:/resources.papa.com/all-ungated-vid-documentary-unseen-connection-recording>)
  * ## Jessica
After caring for her father who had ALS, Jessica was inspired to work as a Papa Pal. Caring for others has made her feel like she has family even when she’s away from her own.
[Read Jessica's Story](https://www.papa.com/<https:/www.papa.com/resources/blog/this-national-family-caregivers-month-celebrate-your-village>)
  * ## Rafael & Connor
Rafael, a 79-year-old veteran who is fiercely independent, enjoys weekly conversations and companionship with his Papa Pal, Connor.
[Meet Rafael and Connor](https://www.papa.com/<https:/www.papa.com/resources/blog/meet-rafael-and-connor>)

Previous itemNext item
  * Navigate to slide 1
  * Navigate to slide 2
  * Navigate to slide 3


Item 1 of 3
## How it works
Available nationwide, in-person or by phone, Papa Pals offer a hand to help, a shoulder to lean on, and an ear to listen.
  1. ### Sign up through your participating plan.
Flexible enrollment processes help members take advantage of their Medicare Advantage, Medicaid, or employer-provided benefit.
  2. ### Schedule a visit with a Papa Pal.
Health plan members can schedule appointments by phone. Employees have the flexibility of using our mobile app for iPhone and Android.
  3. ### Enjoy your time and tell us how we did.
Members and loved ones receive support from Papa Pals for companion care, help with children and pets, transportation, errands, and more. Post-visit surveys help us make sure it’s the perfect pal every time!


### Discover how Papa has raised the bar for what it means to be a safe and trusted companion care platform.
#### Papa’s inaugural transparency report
[View Report](https://www.papa.com/<https:/resources.papa.com/transparency-report-2024>)
## Resources
[See all resources](https://www.papa.com/</resources>)

### [Insights into Individual and Population HealthListen in as two health care professionals share their perspectives on how to best care for our aging population through nuanced health care solutions. ContentVideo](https://www.papa.com/<https:/resources.papa.com/hp-ma-web-panel-insights-into-population-health-gated>)
### [Providing Social Support for Older MembersExplore the challenges older adults experience when aging-in-place, and how health plans can address them while improving outcomes and ROI. ContentGuide](https://www.papa.com/<https:/resources.papa.com/hp-ma-guide-providing-social-support-for-older-members-gated>)

generated_description:
**Company Summary: Papa**

**Overview**  
Papa is your go-to partner in flexible family care, founded in 2017 and based in Miami, Florida. The mission is simple yet profound: to ensure that no one has to go it alone, fostering vital human connections through companion care and assistance with everyday tasks. With a growing team of about 500 employees, Papa is not just working to improve lives but is also actively making strides towards greater equality in the workplace by supporting initiatives like the ParityPledge®.

**Services**  
Papa connects health plans and employers with members and their families to provide compassionate and practical support. Their services include companion care, transportation assistance, help with errands, and more. The emphasis is on maintaining independence for older adults and addressing the unique challenges faced by often marginalized communities. Moreover, for those in need, becoming a "Papa Pal" offers both meaningful work and the chance to make a positive difference in the lives of others.

**Impact**  
The outcomes speak for themselves: research indicates that Papa members experience improved physical and mental well-being, fewer hospital visits, and greater overall satisfaction. For employers, this innovative care model stands as a unique benefit that enhances employee retention and attracts talent by supporting the family's needs. 

**Investors and Growth**  
Papa's growth is backed by high-profile investors such as Canaan, Tiger Global Management, Comcast Ventures, and SoftBank Vision Fund 2. The company is also a proud member of Y Combinator’s Batch S18, which highlights its potential for substantial impact in the consumer health services sector.

**Culture and Employment**  
As an equal opportunity employer, Papa champions diversity at all levels of the organization. They not only seek to uplift those they serve but also create a workplace culture that reflects the diversity of the communities they assist.

For more information, check out their website: [Papa](https://www.papa.com). Whether you're looking for support for your family or an opportunity to give back as a Papa Pal, they have a place for you.
